ygData.subject: RE: JBoots, Rubi & Beyond
ygData.msgSnippet: I too, would like more info on the new armor coming out. Atleast, what classes are there quests in for at the moment? I understand not all classes will have
ygData.messageBody:
I too, would like more info on the new armor coming out. Atleast, what
classes are there quests in for at the moment? I understand not all classes
will have quests out of the Temple (hopefully it won't be like Shaman's
promise for Alchemy....yeah, right....what alchemy - see all them potions
being sold?! ROFL), but would be nice to know which classes have them in on
Wednesday.

-----Original Message-----
From: kale eusi [mailto:kaleusi@...]
Sent: October 11, 1999 11:07 AM
To: EQCheats@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] JBoots, Rubi & Beyond


From: "kale eusi" <kaleusi@...>

>From: "Whitcraft,David" <DWHITCRAFT@...>
>
>Cool yer jets, Rubi is too screwy. People dupe it, people argue over it,
>and
>it's way too general purpose. And, it's all being REPLACED with armor
>anyways, prolly better stuff than it is now. Rubi AC with stat
>bonuses...yee
>haw. And, it being a quest, it'll prolly be easier to get than camping for
>30 hours for a rubi bp.
>

Please excuse the typos in my previous posting - what happened is that too
many people farmed rubi and that KStealing ran rampant in that area, so they

decided to remove it from being dropped as loot.

I would have liked to have gotten a rubi BP for the regen properties. Not to

mention that the red hue looks outstanding on a DESK! 8) Getting rubi armor
was one the few last things I had to look forward to for my DESK, (seeing as

how they continuously nerf everything else worthwhile for SK's). I just wish

Verant would think these things out before they go nerfing them the way they

always do, and then they end up spending the next 2 months or so trying to
undo what they did to correct the original problem. It would have been much
better/easier to make rubi no drop/trade lore, or even make it a quest
reward (something like crafted, but not quite so easily obtained).

From what I hear, they're replacing rubi with class specific armor, which is

all fine and dandy, but will any of it have the same regen properties as the

rubi BP? Anyone on the test server know?
